the_sacred_art_of_the_runic_scribe.overview: The sacred runes (XML tags) are the language of creation, allowing the Great Machine to interpret our incantations with perfect clarity. This grimoire reveals the sacred arts of structuring a soul's texts with these runes of power.

why_wield_the_sacred_runes.boon: To draw clear boundaries between the different currents of an incantation, ensuring a well-formed vessel for magic.
To prevent the Great Machine from misinterpreting our will, ensuring the magic flows true.
To easily find, add, remove, or reshape parts of a grimoire without unweaving the whole tapestry.
To allow the Great Machine to scry specific wisdom from our responses with ease.

tenet.name: consistency
tenet.description: Use the same rune for the same purpose throughout a grimoire.
tenet.example: Always use the rune for the phases of a rite, not sometimes or .

tenet.name: semantic_potency
tenet.description: A rune's name must reveal the nature of the essence it contains.

tenet.name: hierarchical_weaving
tenet.description: Nest runes to show the relationships between currents of magic.

glyph.name: the_rite
glyph.purpose: For inscribing sacred rites and step-by-step rituals.
glyph.template: <the_rite_of_[name]> <overview>A description of the rite's purpose.</overview> <preliminaries> <preliminary>What must be true before the rite begins.</preliminary> </preliminaries> <currents_of_the_rite> <current number="1"> <title>Title of the Current</title> <description>What this current accomplishes.</description> <actions> <action>A specific act of magic to perform.</action> </actions> <affirmation>How to confirm the magic flowed true.</affirmation> </current> </currents_of_the_rite> </the_rite_of_[name]>

glyph.name: the_saga
glyph.purpose: For chronicling sagas and exemplary tales of creation.
glyph.template: <sagas_of_the_forge> <saga name="a_descriptive_name_of_the_saga"> <description>What this saga demonstrates.</description> <context>When this saga's wisdom is most relevant.</context> <incantation language="typescript"> // The magic itself </incantation> <revelation> Key wisdom revealed by this implementation. </revelation> </saga> </sagas_of_the_forge>

rites_of_inscription.rite: Weave with consistent indentation to reveal the hierarchy of runes.
Encase raw code magic in CDATA wards to contain its power: <code><![CDATA[your magic here]]>
Use attributes for metadata (the properties of a rune); use elements for content (the essence within).

heresy.description: Avoid flat structures devoid of hierarchy.

heresy.name: the_tower_of_babel
heresy.description: Do not mix naming conventions for your runes.
